summary: The bill, titled the Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Research and Education Act of 2025, aims to expand research, education, and information dissemination regarding triple-negative breast cancer. It mandates the Director of the National Institutes of Health to increase research efforts, particularly coordinating activities and authorizing appropriations through 2031. It also directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the CDC and HRSA, to develop and disseminate public information and information for healthcare providers on the disease, treatment options, and elevated risks for minority women, with corresponding appropriations.
